Reviews.Title: Aweful Phone!
Reviews.Author: M. Kelly
Reviews.Content: I got this phone back in April 2010 after reading numerous reviews saying how great it was. When I went to my local AT&T; store I didn't hesitate in purchasing it for my upgrade. By June I was regretting my decision all together. It drops calls, I end up with mysterious voice mails and no missed calls, I don't receive all my texts, its really rather useless for me to even use, but I'm stuck with it until I can afford a new one. Overall, I do like the size, weight, and design. However, I hate the operating system and the fact that you cannot remove any of the applications from the menu. They are all built in and require purchase. Also, the internet is horrible I get "unexpected failure" any time I try to do anything with it. Overall its a horrible phone. I will never purchase another Samsung phone again.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: StillWaters
Reviews.Content: I liked this phone because it has a nice design, it's a smartphone, and it has a touch display. For a while it was fine, but then I figured out that it has the worst navigation if you are trying to go online. It displays the buttons as tiny and you can't touch them to click on links. Very frustrating and makes the phone not worth the price right there. It is also difficult to text, and even after callibrating, it makes errors when typing. Sometimes the screen would freeze and I would not be able to unlock it, and sometimes when dialing a number or typing a text, you would press one button and another one would be pressed (if you pressed a 2, the 1 would go). After having it for about a year and a half, it started doing this all the time, and I was no longer able to type in numbers or text at all. The only way I could make a phone call was to look someone up in my address book and press the bottom call button. The screen did not work at all, so if I wanted to call someone not on  my list, I was out of luck. I ended up buying a cheap phone just to replace this one until my next upgrade.Also, it has a set of screensavers built in and you can't change them or delete them. They randomly display. One of the pictures is of a bunch of flowers and a butterfly. My boyfriend also owned this phone, and it's kind of stupid that he has no choice but to have a girly butterfly picture on his screensaver, and no way to change it.

Reviews.Title: Sucks waste of money
Reviews.Author: Essie Carlson
Reviews.Content: Sucks works better if you get it at AT&T; waste of time money and I wouldn't get it works better from AT&T;

Reviews.Title: The worst phone I have used ever
Reviews.Author: ambu
Reviews.Content: the touchscreen is NOT at all friendly...it often drops the call. Sometimes it hangs up on its own...screen size is okay...also it heats up after 5-10 minutes of continuous talkworst model from samsung

Reviews.Title: Great phone w/o data plan
Reviews.Author: MrsKuchiki "Tweety FAN"
Reviews.Content: The battery lasts a long time even playing music. I used my phone for music for 8hrs straight. When I turened it off, I still have 4 bars left. Internet and camera works fine if u want to use it. Never had any problems and i have had the phone for almost 2 years now. It was a good decision. it is also very cute and thin.

Reviews.Title: LOOOVE THIS PHONE!
Reviews.Author: barbara
Reviews.Content: I've had my Samsung Mythic phone for just over a year now, and am just sick over the fact that last night I accidently tossed it in the washing machine with the bedsheets. :(  I read the crappy reviews on here, and I can't believe we have the same phone!  This phone is SO simple and user friendly, I bought my 75 yr old mom the SAME PHONE at the same time I bought mine.  I taught her to TEXT on it (something she has NEVER done before) and we txt all the time!  She knows how to take photos, how to access the menus, everything.  And she doesn't even own a computer!  So SERIOUSLY, how HARD could it be to use???The awesome thing about txting ability is, you can either use the keyboard, OR, you can draw on the screen with your FINGERNAIL and WRITE the letters on the screen! You CANNOT do that on a smart phone as they only recognize TOUCH with a finger.  Too cool!There are UMPTEEN WAYS to access features on here, so if one is easier than another for you, you just choose which one you like best.  Such as: there is an awesome touch screen pull out menu that gives you all kinds of instant features like volume, time, alarm, etc. AND there is a scroll photo fast find address w/ picture id that I love, for all the people frequently called.The camera is a 3.0 megapixil WITH flash, AND you can change the lighting to whatever setting you are in: daylight, incandescent, florescent, etc.  AND it does video and shares it!  I confess to never having figured out the zoom on it, tho.  I'm sure there is a way, just never figured it out, and the guys at ATT were not particulary helpful.Mythic is and isn't a smartphone.  IF you use the internet constantly, you should really get something like the Samsung Captivate which my hubby has and he LOVES IT!  I simply don't do that much internet surfing, so chose a phone for mom and I that we didn't automatically have to pay the $25. a month internet activation fee.  I have a limited data pkg that allows me access to facebook, email and whatever for ten bucks a month.Again, I don't know what on earth these other people were trying to do with their phone, but if my 75 yr ol mom can handle it and loves it, I think it's pretty darn simple.  I am sick that I ruined mine, but I know where I can purchase another!!

Reviews.Title: Poop with a battery stuck in it.
Reviews.Author: Heath
Reviews.Content: This phone is the worst phone ever! It drops calls, completely skips calls and I get voicemails later. It would tell me I had a text and I would click read and it would glitch and go back to the lock screen. The screen is probably the weakest thing ever. It has scratches a;ll over it, and I took good care of it. It's not overstuffed with files, and it's slow! SLOW! It sucks. I'm upgrading to a samsung infuse 4g as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: No Stars For Me
Reviews.Author: AliMarJo
Reviews.Content: If I could rate this and give it no stars, I absolutely would. This phone has to be the junkiest phone that I've ever owned. It drops calls a lot, I do not get all of my incoming calls, but end up with voicemails sometimes days later, and switching inbetween call waiting is a nightmare. I do not get all of my text messages. I also hate that if I set my alarm clock on it, wake up before the alarm goes off and turn the alarm off (the "alarm icon" disappears when I turn it off, so I know that I've successfully selected "off"), it still proceeds to go off at the initial set time The quality of the vidoes and photos are horrible (not that I use the phone for that, but still). Lastly, when I'm on the internet whether it be browsing or on facebook, I always get "unexpected error" as well as "failure" messages over and over again, and sometimes I cannot post what I was initially trying to post at all. It's very aggrevating. I'll be glad when I can afford to get another phone. For anyone wondering, it is not the service provider's problem, nor is it a "low bar" issue. My husband and I both have AT&T; but he has a different phone, and never has any problems with it. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE!

Reviews.Title: Best Phone w/o Data Plan Requirement
Reviews.Author: Virtually Done
Reviews.Content: Most phones now days (android, windows phone, apple ect) they all require you to purchase a data plan along with unlimited texting. I bought this phone back in August of 2010. Overall it is a very good phone. I rarely have any issues with [the operating system] or the phone in general. I like how it is thin and lightweight [for the most part]. The mythic is just like all the other samsung phones as far as the operating system, menu setup, homepage ect. The only difference,  mythic is all touch screen and no qwerty keyboard. If you have previously had a samsung phone in the past and did not like it or is looking for something different, then this is not the phone for you.However, if you do like samsung's phones this is just like all the rest.Here is my "review" of some of the features this phone offers: (Out of 10)Camera: 1  -Its a cell phone camera what do you expectCalibration: 6.5  - Sometimes messes up, but you can recalibrate it anytimeBattery Life: 8  - As far as phones go this is pretty goodTouch Screen(In General)-4.5  - Has some delay, do not expect it to be as responsive as apple phones*Operating System: 8

Reviews.Title: Battery not good
Reviews.Author: CindyLunsford
Reviews.Content: I love the phone.  I ordered the exact phone I had before.... BUT, it will not hold a charge.  My old phone battery is better than this new battery.  I would like a new battery.

Reviews.Title: Looks quit ok, but not the one
Reviews.Author: Shams
Reviews.Content: The cell phone looks very pretty. It is not heavy or too big or too small.The device has some serious problems that makes you not buy it.The first problem is the touchpad. It is not comfortable at all. You have to push hard to make an action.The second problem is the operating system. It is not Android. It is a special OS designed for AT&T.; So you can not find proper applications easily.The third problem is the internal memory. The internal memory is too small, and you need to get a SD card to take pictures and movies.The fourth problem is WIFI. Even though, it is written on its box that it comes with WiFi capabilities, it does not. No Wireless.In general I do not recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Diappointed and Frustrated
Reviews.Author: Darla
Reviews.Content: This phone came in promptly.  It worked for 10 days and the touchscreen became unresponsive.  I tried taking the battery out for a few minutes several times. I did not drop this phone or get it wet or anything unusual.  I did contact the seller and they said they didn't know what I was doing with the phone for 10 days.  I could not RESET the phone because the touchscreen would not work.  I am very disappointed and will not ever buy from this seller again or recommend them.  The restocking fee for this phone was as much as I paid for it so it's not worth sending it back for a refund....it would end up costing me more than I spent in the first place.  At least I would've expected the seller to try and help fix the problem or offer to replace it.  Lesson learned!  This is my first  negative experience with an AMAZON seller.

Reviews.Title: Transaction & Product Rating.
Reviews.Author: Marilyn S Kern
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to replace another Mythic that no longer worked. It came with a batter 1/2 the capacity of the phone that I'd had, requiring frequent charging.  I forgot that I'd upgraded the battery in the first phone.  New battery is on order and should fix the problem.  Great product, shipped promptly and arrived as billed.  Excellent transaction.

Reviews.Title: Very good!
Reviews.Author: Andreina Salazar
Reviews.Content: My mother wanted a simple mobile, good quality and that suited her. Your favorite brand is Samsung and it was an excellent idea to get this model. She is very happy with his new cell phone.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: I
Reviews.Content: excellent quality great shipping prompt response took care of problem fast now I use product on stand by for two days or call all day and no problem at all

Reviews.Title: Samsung Mythic- poor
Reviews.Author: j13jillpills
Reviews.Content: Quality was low, battery life-awful! Wondering if it was refurbished or just a crappy phone. I used to have this phone years ago when it was new, I do not like the one received from this seller.

Reviews.Title: it looks just beautiful ONLY!!
Reviews.Author: Palls53
Reviews.Content: Touchscreen is terrible. You need to press the screen really hard to get the 'correct' thing done. Otherwise, it will stay dumb! I used to have iPhone before for 2 years, and I got this one only to get rid of dataplan (as I was not using dataplan much). This phone doesn't need to have dataplan and that's the only good thing about this phone.Other things like crystal clear home screens which change every time the phone is in locked position, makes it look something interesting. But that is not any convenient feature I was looking for!I had hard time in adding contacts or notes. Searching contacts by scrolling is very challenging and you need to get used to some 'special skills'.Overall, I am going to use this only to make calls and nothing else. This phone is not good at all for texting or even surfing internet (If you take 3G plan, you can use internet in this phone). Browsing is something terrible to do in this phone.If you are looking for browsing (3G) feature along with calling and texting, this is not a good phone.I am using it only for voice calls and I am going to dump it in future.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Samsung Eternity
Reviews.Author: Roger A. Wolf "Alyn"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung Mythic as an upgrade to my Samsung Eternity. I'm glad I kept the Eternity as it is a better phone in all respects. I recently switched my AT@T Sim card back to the Eternity and couldn't be happier. The only thing lacking on the Eternity is speed dialing which I can get along without. See other reviews on the Mythic to understand the undesirable bugs that have to be dealt with in everyday use of the Mythic. Below is my previous review of the Eternity, old reliable. Not sure if you can find one of them anymore, but would certainly be worth a search if you are in the market for one of the better feature phones ever made.The wife and I obtained two of these Samsung Eternity cell phones brand new on an AT@T contract over 5 years ago. They have been one of the better investments we have ever made. Mine is still rock solid. Hers finally died; probably from old age and constant use. We have tried other phones before and since with none of them comparing to the Eternity. Keep in mind that we have no desire for smartphone technology or use. This is probably one of the better basic cell phones out there. It is the right size, wonderful touch screen, great ergonomics, with wonderful clarity coming and going. The 3 meg camera produces astonishingly good photos. I can only attribute that to what must be an above average lens. Everything works correctly for our purposes. I really like the way I get the large QWERTY virtual keyboard when I turn the phone horizontally for texting. I do find it somewhat difficult to text on any touch screen, but find that this one works better than most. It has that slight vibration feedback on every key stroke. It fits quite well in a belt case. About the only negative I have is that the speaker phone can produce some distortion especially if the volume is turned up too loud. Every time we think about upgrading to smartphones we decline because of the overpriced data charges, larger size, and complexity. Besides, we would rather use a second device with a larger screen such as our Samsung tablets for wi-fi internet away from home. We are even thinking about purchasing two more Eternities used or refurbished to hold in reserve. They are that good.

Reviews.Title: unfriendly eye candy
Reviews.Author: Miami
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because it did not require a data plan and it certainly was new and flashy.Given the features it offers it could be satisfactory as a very good looking toy. Maybe it is a kid's phone. However, as an adult I found the tactile qualities very disappointing. The durability of the materials used is questionable. I never seemed to get it out of my pocket and answered before it would go to answer. The screen can not be seen except on dark moonless nights. The battery life is hard to judge given it will die with no notice.I found its method of doing things unnecessarily complex and very user unfriendly. This is the only cell phone I have owned that I could never get used to.Within two months I went back to wonderful old Razor V3 and have celebrated each day of its goneness.

Reviews.Title: Terrible, even for picky people
Reviews.Author: Amanda C
Reviews.Content: I really hate this phone. I've had it for nearly 4 years and I'm finally getting an upgrade. (Now, I didn't have a data plan so I never used this phone for surfing the web. All I used it for was alarms, calling, and texting.)Calls: It drops calls like no other, even when it says I have five bars of reception. It will tell me I have a voicemail, but it won't tell me I got a call beforehand. Sometimes it won't tell me I have a voicemail until the next day! The voicemail also doesn't have a timestamp on it - when you see the voicemail icon on the pop up box (the only good thing about this phone), it just says the current time and date, not the time/date the voicemail was received. The speakerphone is okay, but the ear speaker is really quiet. Most times I have to plug my other ear to hear the other person. Switching between calls using call waiting is clunky and doesn't always work.Texting: This is mainly what I use the phone for. The keyboard is not great. I only ever type on the sideways keyboard because I never got the typing with the numbers thing. If you type a message and want to delete half of it, you have to repeatedly TAP TAP TAP TAP on the backspace button to delete the message letter by letter, because if you hold it down for more than 2 seconds, it deletes the WHOLE message. Pain in the arse. The backspace is right above the OK button, which is right above the SEND button after it switches to the send screen. This results in trying to delete a word, but your finger slips and hits the OK button, which switches the screen and sends the half-written text. Also, the character limit is ridiculously short. Most of the time I end up sending my friends 2 messages instead of one because my text was 'too long'. It also doesn't tell you how many characters you have left - it just says '2295' at the top left corner and counts down, which is useless because it only seems to like sending 190ish characters at a time. Also, deleting texts after the phone's memory is full takes FOREVER. There it NO autocorrect either. It's called T9 predictive text, which acts kind of like autocorrect, but it makes typing about three times slower because it has to think about what you might mean. Keyboard also freezes all the time.Battery: The battery life itself is fine. I normally charge the phone every four or five days. But the problem I have with it is when the battery bar shows two bars left, it won't last more than an hour. Then it will BUZZ like a freaking angry hornet every five seconds, which is TERRIBLE when you're talking on the phone. When it's charging from the AC adapter (which hardly stays in the phone's plug, by the way), the screen will blink on and it will beep when the battery is full. Not useful when you plug it in before bed and it wakes you up in the middle of the night with a beep and a bright screen by your bed side.Screen savers: YOU CAN'T CHANGE THEM. At all. There are about 8 of them that it cycles through every time you unlock the phone. It has some nice abstract ones, a sunset over a bridge, some fireworks, but then it has a butterfly on a flower. I don't really mind, but I can imagine if a guy had this phone he would be frustrated with that picture popping up every so often. And it really bothers me that you CAN'T CHANGE THEM OR DELETE THEM.THE ONLY GOOD THINGS:Multiple alarmsShortcuts you can put on the home screen for a new text or Bluetootha Pop-up box that takes you directly to new messages, missed calls, or voicemailYou CAN get picture messagesYou can type with your fingernail or a pencil (though I always have to type with my fingernails since the keyboard sucks)Just get a different phone. Seriously. Get one with a larger screen, better autocorrect, and less call-dropping.

Reviews.Title: Got this phone for a friend.
Reviews.Author: Evaristo E. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I got and took this phone for a love one in Costa Rica and they seem to love it; needless to say it work there.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Georgia Girl
Reviews.Content: After researching many phones I decided on the Samsung Mythic then started looking for the best price which I found on Amazon.  Phone works great with no problems getting it activated from my provider.

Reviews.Title: so thankful for my mythic
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: i was so thankful to find another mythic.  i didn't want a smart phone and was thankful to find the same mythic i had.  i love it!

Reviews.Title: Love this product
Reviews.Author: Donald O. Capstick
Reviews.Content: Love this product; the best part is I am not forced to pay an extra $30 for an Internet service upgrade that would bump me out my currently very economical cell service.

Reviews.Title: Horrbile Phone
Reviews.Author: MarkT
Reviews.Content: One of the worst phones I ever used.The piece looks good, light weight, and smart, but works horrible.You can't customize the menu, its fixed by AT&T;, slider Menu is of no you, you have to drag the shortcuts from slider Menu onto screen the use the application. If you want to keep your wallpaper clean, you need to drag bag the shortcut again into the slider.And of all, I can't give you a detailed review since my touch dead with in 2 weeks, I googled for more info, and found that there are lots of complaints about the same.If you want to buy this phone, please don't throw away yours old phone, you are going to need it soon.

Reviews.Title: not worth the price.
Reviews.Author: brain
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this phone in august 2010, the design of the phone is wikid good its well constructed, the camera is very nice, 3.5/regular headset jack is VERY convenient. The phones looks are very appealing however I learned that looks can be misleading the phones operating system is absolute crap to say the least it drops calls, if you have big fingers typing on this phone will be a nightmare, if you place a widget somewhere it will move it on its own, I've had this phone make call someone while I was holding it in my pocket, Its EXTREMELY EXTREMELY EXTREMELY laggy, sometimes if you get a voicemail or txt the alert will stay up for like a week or so, the 2-3 things that absolutely annoy me with this phone are if your web browsing it'll lag on a link u clicked and if you click it again it'll come up with an "unexpected failure" notice atleast 5 times! it'll refuse to play youtube videos due to a format & it won't download certain pictures due to support issues.Honestly if it didn't say unexpected failure or didn't lag as bad I'd rate this phone 4 stars.build quality & camera = 5+ starsoperating system = -5

Reviews.Title: Samsung Mythic
Reviews.Author: Mikevin
Reviews.Content: The speaker is the only let down.  It distorts when it is turned all the way up.  The phone works well otherwise.

Reviews.Title: It is a nice phone but it has issues
Reviews.Author: Corrine "on the beach"
Reviews.Content: The touch pad will just freeze on the phone, or the left half will stop working. If you take it apart, remove the battery, the SIM card, and the micro SD card let it sit on the table for at least an hour. When you put it back together (after it has had a rest), as soon as it is on go fast to settings, and calibrate the phone with a stylus not your finger. The phone will work again for a few months. It is a nice touch screen phone that doesn't need a "smart" phone plan, we have had 2 of these for the last couple of years.

Reviews.Title: Great phone.
Reviews.Author: jkt1
Reviews.Content: Got my first one from ATT 2yrs.ago and did not want to have to change adaptors etc. and learn a new phone when the touch screen started to malfunction. Love it.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: legalshelly
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this Mythic phone.  It is very easy to use.  The compact size is nice.  I bought the gel skin protector for it and that fits very well.

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
3G-enabled messaging/social networking phone with 3.3-inch touchscreen and intuitive Samsung TouchWiz interface
Compatible with AT&T; Video Share, AT&T; Mobile Music, and streaming video from Cellular Video service; AT&T; Mobile TV capabilities
3.2-megapixel camera/camcorder; Bluetooth stereo music; MicroSD memory expansion to 16 GB; access to personal email
Up to 3 hours of talk time, up to 360 hours (15 days) of standby time
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung Mythic A897 Unlocked Phone with Touch Screen, 3.2 MP Camera and 3G Support - US Warranty - Black
